edu.lafayette.bci.devices

Class Emotiv

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lafayette.bci.devices.Emotiv

  • public class Emotiv
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the Emotiv headset. This class is meant to encapsulate the Emotiv SDK from the rest of the application, providing only the necessary data to observers. It handles all initialization and data extraction from the emotiv engine. Event handling is done in an asynchronous, non-blocking manner, so updates are not guaranteed to occur on the main thread.
    Author:
    Haley Garrison

      Gyroscope sampling period for the Emotiv.
      static int SAMPLE_RATE_IN_MS
      The sampling period of the headset for all 14 electrodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Emotiv

        public Emotiv()
        Creates a new Emotiv instance and starts Emotiv updates to observers. A separate thread is used to poll for updates in order to prevent blocking.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Cleans up the allocated resources and stops the observer updates.

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(EmotivObserver o)
        Adds an EmotivObserver to the list and begins sending updates to the new observer.
        Parameters:
        o - The new EmotivObserver

      • removeObserver

        public void removeObserver(EmotivObserver o)
        Removes an EmotivObserver from the list and stops sending updates to the observer.
        Parameters:
        o - The EmotivObserver to remove

      • getSensorValue

        public double getSensorValue(java.lang.String sensor)
        Returns the most recent reading from the specified sensor.
        Parameters:
        sensor - The name of the desired sensor (ex. "AF3", "O2").
        Returns:
        The value of the most recent reading from sensor

      • getSensorQuality

        public double getSensorQuality(java.lang.String sensor)
        Returns the most recent quality value for the specified sensor.
        Parameters:
        sensor - The name of the desired sensor (ex. "AF3", "O2").
        Returns:
        The quality of the sensor. Max is 10 and min is 0

      • getGyroValue

        public double getGyroValue(java.lang.String axis)
        Returns the most recent reading from the specified gyro axis. Values range from 0-255.
        Parameters:
        axis - The name of the axis (either "x" or "y")
        Returns:
        The value of the gyroscope on the specified axis

      • getBatteryPercent

        public int getBatteryPercent()
        Returns the percent of battery remaining.
        Returns:
        Battery percentage (between 0-100)
